concept_data.title: Resolution of the Council of the European Union

summary: The "Resolution of the Council of the European Union" refers to formal decisions or positions adopted by the Council, which is one of the key institutions in the EU's legislative framework. These resolutions often address specific issues, guiding member states on various regulatory matters or articulating the EU's stance on international affairs. While not legally binding, they carry significant political weight and influence the legislative process. The resolutions can serve as a precursor to binding legislation or as a means of expressing collective intent among member states, thereby shaping EU law and policy in diverse areas, including economic governance and foreign relations.
